009package imagingbook.common.mser;
010
011import java.util.Arrays;
012
013import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntDouble;
014import imagingbook.common.geometry.ellipse.GeometricEllipse;
015import imagingbook.common.math.Eigensolver2x2;
016import imagingbook.common.mser.components.Component;
017
018/**
019 * A container holding the data for calculating MSER properties.
020 * Instances of this type are attached to {@link Component} during
021 * MSER calculation in {@link MserDetector}.
022 */
023public class MserData {
024        
025        private final Component<MserData> component;    // reference to associated component
026        
027        public MserData(Component<MserData> c) {
028                this.component = c;
029        }
030        
031        /** True iff component is a MSER */
032        public boolean isMser = false;                  // should be protected at least!
033
034        /** Component size variation (wrt. to the size at delta levels higher), undefined = -1 */
035        protected float variation = -1;
036        
037        /** Component stability status */
038        protected boolean isStable = true;
039        
040        /** Component coordinate ordinary moments (m10, m01, m20, m02, m11) */
041        protected long[] stats = null;
042        
043        /** Central moments of pixel coordinates (mu10, mu01, mu20, mu02, mu11) */
044        private double[] moments = null;
045        
046        /** Reference to the equivalent ellipse */
047        private GeometricEllipse ellipse = null;
048        
049        /**
050         * Returns the vector of central moments (mu10, mu01, mu20, mu02, mu11).
051         * @return the vector of central moments
052         */
053        public double[] getCentralMoments() {
054                return this.moments;
055        }
056        
057        public double[][] getCovarianceMatrix() {
058                double[] mu = getCentralMoments(); // = (mu10, mu01, mu20, mu02, mu11)
059                final int size = component.getSize();
060                double[][] S = {
061                                {mu[2]/size, mu[4]/size},
062                                {mu[4]/size, mu[3]/size}};
063                return S;
064        }
065        
066        /**
067         * Returns the center point for the associated component.
068         * @return the center point
069         */
070        public PntDouble getCenter() {
071                double mu10 = moments[0];
072                double mu01 = moments[1];
073                return PntDouble.from(mu10, mu01);
074        }
075        
076        /**
077         * Returns the equivalent ellipse for the associated component.
078         * @return the equivalent ellipse
079         */
080        public GeometricEllipse getEllipse() {
081                return this.ellipse;
082        }
083        
084        /**
085         * Calculates the central moments and the equivalent ellipse
086         * for the associated component.
087         */
088        protected void init() {
089                calculateMoments();
090                makeEllipse();
091        }
092        
093        private void calculateMoments() {
094                double n = component.getSize();
095                double mu10 = stats[0] / n;
096                double mu01 = stats[1] / n;
097                double mu20 = stats[2] - stats[0] * stats[0] / n; // = size times the covariance, see Book p.750
098                double mu02 = stats[3] - stats[1] * stats[1] / n;
099                double mu11 = stats[4] - stats[0] * stats[1] / n;
100                this.moments = new double[] {mu10, mu01, mu20, mu02, mu11};
101        }
102        
103        private void makeEllipse() {
104                final double n = component.getSize();
105                final double mu10 = moments[0];
106                final double mu01 = moments[1];
107                final double mu20 = moments[2];
108                final double mu02 = moments[3];
109                final double mu11 = moments[4];
110                Eigensolver2x2 es = new Eigensolver2x2(mu20, mu11, mu11, mu02);
111                double ra = 2 * Math.sqrt(es.getRealEigenvalue(0) / n); // correct (see Book p.238)
112                double rb = 2 * Math.sqrt(es.getRealEigenvalue(1) / n);
113                double[] x1 = es.getEigenvector(0).toArray();
114                double theta = Math.atan2(x1[1], x1[0]);
115                this.ellipse = new GeometricEllipse(ra, rb, mu10, mu01, theta);
116        }
117        
118//      /**
119//       * Sorts a list of MSERs by (decreasing) component size, i.e.,
120//       * the largest MSER (with the most pixels) becomes the first.
121//       * 
122//       * @param msers a list of {@link MSER} instances
123//       */
124//      public static void sortBySize(List<Component<MserData>> msers) {
125//              Comparator<Component<MserData>> cmp = new Comparator<Component<MserData>>() {
126//                      @Override
127//                      public int compare(Component<MserData> mser1, Component<MserData> mser2) {
128//                              return Integer.compare(mser2.getSize(), mser1.getSize());
129//                      }
130//              };
131//              Collections.sort(msers, cmp);
132//      }
133
134        @Override
135        public String toString() {
136                return String.format("variation=%.2f stability=%d stats=%s",
137                                variation, isStable, (stats == null) ? "x" : Arrays.toString(stats));
138        }
139        
140
141}
